intro: Haastia, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a genus of flowering plants native to New Zealand. These plants are characterized by their tall, sturdy stems and large, lance-shaped leaves that can grow up to several meters in length. Haastia species are typically found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. They produce small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale pink, adding ornamental value to their appearance. The plant has historical significance for Māori people, who used its fibers for weaving and other traditional purposes.
